since_last_update: Policy shock escalated: Trump said he would raise tariffs on South Korean goods (autos/lumber/pharma) to 25% from 15%, injecting fresh trade-policy risk premium and cross-asset hedging demand (Reuters).

Tech/AI supply-chain narrative broadened: Microsoft unveiling an in-house AI chip adds a new angle to the “AI capex + GPU dependency” debate, raising dispersion risk inside mega-cap/semis and potentially increasing NQ idiosyncratic beta to chip headlines (LOCAL).
Market-structure warning flag: large sell-skew closing imbalances (S&P/Nasdaq/Mag7) increased late-day downside/vol sensitivity and may have tightened risk limits into today’s session (LOCAL).
today_focus: Dominant driver check (today): “Fed into earnings” setup—risk tone and index leadership are being steered by earnings headlines while markets hold directional conviction until the FOMC decision window (AP).

Secondary driver: trade-policy uncertainty re-entered the tape via South Korea tariff threat; watch for spillover into autos/industrials/semis supply-chain sensitivity and any USD/gold safe-haven impulse (Reuters, Washington Post).

Gold focus: safe-haven bid and pre-Fed positioning appear to be the framing; if real yields/dollar firm on hawkish Fed read-through, gold becomes the stress-test of ‘risk-off but rates-up’ correlation (Yahoo Finance).

US data at 10:00 ET: Conference Board Consumer Confidence + Richmond Fed—used as a last “growth tone” input before the FOMC blackout feel; could matter mainly through front-end rate expectations and equity-duration sensitivity (calendar).

market_pricing.rates_path: Base case remains a hold at this week’s FOMC; near-term repricing risk is mainly in guidance/press conference tone (hawkish-hold vs dovish-hold) rather than the decision itself (Polymarket context).
market_pricing.equity_factor_map: Index performance likely dominated by mega-cap earnings sensitivity and AI/semis dispersion; NQ remains more exposed to real-rate moves and single-name gaps than ES.
market_pricing.gold_regime: Gold appears priced for elevated uncertainty/safe-haven demand into the Fed; vulnerability is a sudden real-yield impulse higher (hawkish Fed or stronger data) that forces de-leveraging rather than a slow drift.
market_pricing.policy_risk_premium: Trade-policy tail risk is creeping back into pricing; the market response may be nonlinear if tariff threats broaden beyond Korea or become legally/operationally concrete.

risk_register.risk: FOMC communication shock (hawkish-hold lifts real yields -> pressures Nasdaq-duration; dovish-hold can reflate duration but destabilize USD/gold correlations).
Trade-policy escalation/contagion from South Korea tariff threat into broader tariff actions, raising stagflation-style risk (equities down while yields up) or abrupt risk-off with safe-haven bid.
Mega-cap earnings concentration risk (index-level gaps driven by a handful of tech names; NQ vs ES divergence and overnight headline gaps).
Gold positioning air-pocket risk: if Fed messaging or data lifts real yields/USD quickly, gold could see mechanical profit-taking despite elevated geopolitical/policy uncertainty.
Late-day liquidity/auction sensitivity (imbalance-driven moves and gamma effects) amplifying otherwise modest macro impulses.

event_warnings: 10:00 ET Jan 27: Conference Board Consumer Confidence + Richmond Fed—watch for rate-sensitive reaction rather than pure ‘growth’ narrative.
16:00 ET Jan 27: Trump speaks—elevated probability of policy/trade headline volatility given recent tariff messaging (Reuters/WashPost context).
14:00 ET Jan 28: FOMC decision; 14:30 ET press conference—primary macro catalyst of the week for ES/NQ and gold via real-yield/terminal-rate narrative.
08:30 ET Jan 29: Initial jobless claims—can move front-end rates quickly in a ‘Fed-week’ tape.
08:30 ET Jan 30: PPI (headline/core)—second-order but can affect inflation-risk premium and gold/real-yield dynamics.
